name: DatePicker
description: The DatePicker component should be used whenever the user is to enter a single date or a date period.

props.name: date
props.doc: Defines the pre-filled date by either a JavaScript DateInstance or (ISO 8601) like `date="2019-05-05"` and `content`.

props.name: startDate
props.doc: To set the pre-filled starting date. Is used if `range={true}` is set to `true`. Defaults to `null`, showing the `maskPlaceholder`.

props.name: endDate
props.doc: To set the pre-filled ending date. Is used if `range={true}` is set to `true`. Defaults to `null`, showing the `maskPlaceholder`.

props.name: month
props.doc: To display what month should be shown in the first calendar by default. Defaults to the `date` respective `startDate`.

props.name: startMonth
props.doc: To display what month should be shown in the first calendar by default. Defaults to the `date` respective `startDate`.

props.name: endMonth
props.doc: To display what month should be shown in the second calendar by default. Defaults to the `date` respective `startDate`.

props.name: minDate
props.doc: To limit a date range to a minimum `startDate`. Defaults to `null`.

props.name: maxDate
props.doc: To limit a date range to a maximum `endDate`. Defaults to `null`.

props.name: dateFormat
props.doc: Defines how the property dates (`date`, `startDate` and `endDate`) should be parsed, e.g. `yyyy/MM/dd`. Defaults to `yyyy-MM-dd`.

props.name: returnFormat
props.doc: Defines how the returned date, as a string, should be formatted as. Defaults to `yyyy-MM-dd`.

props.name: range
props.doc: Defines if the date picker should support a range of two dates (starting and ending date).Defaults to `false`.

props.name: showInput
props.doc: If the input fields with the mask should be visible. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: inline
props.doc: If set to `true`, renders the calendar inline without a button or input. The calendar is always visible and not wrapped in a Popover. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: maskOrder
props.doc: To define the order of the masked placeholder input fields. Defaults to `dd/mm/yyyy`.

props.name: opened
props.doc: To open the date-picker by default. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: maskPlaceholder
props.doc: To display the placeholder on input. Defaults to `dd/mm/책책책책`.

props.name: hideNavigation
props.doc: If set to `true`, the navigation will be hidden. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: hideDays
props.doc: If set to `true`, the week days will be hidden. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: showSubmitButton
props.doc: If set to `true`, a submit button will be shown. You can change the default text by using `submitButtonText="Ok"`. Defaults to `false`. If the `range` property is `true`, then the submit button is shown.

props.name: showCancelButton
props.doc: If set to `true`, a cancel button will be shown. You can change the default text by using `cancelButtonText="Avbryt"`. If the `range` property is `true`, then the cancel button is shown. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: showResetButton
props.doc: If set to `true`, a reset button will be shown. You can change the default text by using `resetButtonText="Tilbakestill"`. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: link
props.doc: Link both calendars, once to the user is navigating between months. Only meant to use if the range is set to `true`. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: sync
props.doc: Sync input values with the calendars views. Once the input values get changed, the calendar changes its views in sync. Defaults to `true`.

props.name: firstDay
props.doc: To define the first day of the week. Defaults to `monday`.

props.name: alignPicker
props.doc: Use `right` to change the preferred calendar alignment direction. Defaults to `left`. If the DatePicker is close to the edge of the screen, the alignment of the calendar will change automatically to fit in the viewport.

props.name: skipPortal
props.doc: If set to `true`, the calendar will not be rendered inside a react portal. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: yearNavigation
props.doc: Will enable year navigation in the calendar if set to `true`. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: labelAlignment
props.doc: Sets the alignment of the label. Defaults to `left`.

props.name: onlyMonth
props.doc: Use `true` to only show the defined month. Disables the month navigation possibility. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: hideLastWeek
props.doc: Use `true` to only show the last week in the current month if it needs to be shown. The result is that there will mainly be shows five (5) weeks (rows) instead of six (6). Defaults to `false`.

props.name: stretch
props.doc: If set to `true`, then the date-picker input field will be 100% in `width`.

props.name: label
props.doc: A prepending label in sync with the date input field.

props.name: labelDirection
props.doc: Use `label_direction="vertical"` to change the label layout direction. Defaults to `horizontal`.

props.name: suffix
props.doc: Text describing the content of the DatePicker more than the label. You can also send in a React component, so it gets wrapped inside the DatePicker component.

props.name: labelSrOnly
props.doc: Use `true` to make the label only readable by screen readers.

props.name: shortcuts
props.doc: Gives you the possibility to set predefined dates and date ranges so the user can select these by one click. Define either a JSON or an object with the defined shortcuts. More info is below.

props.name: addonElement
props.doc: Gives you the possibility to inject a React element showing up over the footer. Use it to customize `shortcuts`.

props.name: inputElement
props.doc: Gives you the possibility to use a plain/vanilla `<input />` HTML element by defining it as a string `inputElement="input"`, a React element, or a render function `inputElement={(internalProps) => (<Return />)}`. Can also be used in circumstances where the `react-text-mask` should not be used, e.g. in testing environments. Defaults to custom masked input.

props.name: status
props.doc: Text with a status message. The style defaults to an error message. You can use `true` to only get the status color, without a message.

props.name: statusState
props.doc: Defines the state of the status. Currently, there are two statuses `[error, info]`. Defaults to `error`.

props.name: statusProps
props.doc: Use an object to define additional FormStatus properties.

props.name: disableAutofocus
props.doc: Once the date picker gets opened, there is a focus handling to ensure good accessibility. This can be disabled with this property. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: globalStatus
props.doc: The [configuration](/uilib/components/global-status/properties/#configuration-object) used for the target [GlobalStatus](/uilib/components/global-status).

props.name: tooltip
props.doc: Provide a short Tooltip content that shows up on the picker button.

props.name: skeleton
props.doc: If set to `true`, an overlaying skeleton with animation will be shown.

props.name: size
props.doc: The sizes you can choose is `small` (1.5rem), `default` (2rem), `medium` (2.5rem) and `large` (3rem) are supported component sizes. Defaults to `default` / `null`.

events.name: onChange
events.doc: Will be called on a date change event. Returns an object. See Returned Object below.

events.name: onType
events.doc: Will be called on every input and date picker interaction. Returns an `object`. See Returned Object below.

events.name: onSubmit
events.doc: Will be called once a user presses the submit button.

events.name: onCancel
events.doc: Will be called once a user presses the cancel button.

events.name: onReset
events.doc: Will be called once a user presses the reset button.

events.name: onShow
events.doc: Will be called once date-picker is visible.

events.name: onHide
events.doc: Will be called once date-picker is hidden.

events.name: onDaysRender
events.doc: Will be called right before every new calendar view gets rendered. See the example above.

events.name: onFocus
events.doc: Will be called once the input gets focus.

events.name: onBlur
events.doc: Will be called once the input lose focus.
